For all datasets, users and items that interacted less than five times are filtered out. And the max length of user behaviors is set to 20. The statics of these datasets after processing are summarized in Table 1.

references:
The performance results of different methods on various benchmark datasets and recommenders are shown in Table 2.
Firstly, we observe that LS, POP+ and CSN achieves better performance compared to Base, confirming the necessity of learning with soft targets.
Moreover, different from these methods, we introduce a novel decoupled soft target optimization framework for recommendation, which allows to flexibly adjust the weights of the target confidence and non-target items. As a result, DeSoRec performs best on most benchmark datasets and models, demonstrating the effectiveness and generality of the proposed method.

references: We investigate the wide-ranging utility of our decoupled optimization framework by integrating it with alternative soft label generation techniques. As documented in Table 3, the results clearly demonstrate that our optimization framework is universally effective across different soft label generation methods. Moreover, we find that our framework further enhancements to the label propagation algorithm, underscoring the capacity of our soft label generation approach.

S4.T4.caption: Table 4: Ablation study of each decoupled objectives on YoutubeDNN.
S4.T4.table:
Method Diginetica Last.FM
R@10 N@10 R@10 N@10
Base 0.1077 0.0684 0.1850 0.1545
Target Confidence only 0.1145 0.0716 0.1932 0.1603
Non-target Distribution only 0.0753 0.0432 0.1138 0.0736
DeSoRec 0.1247 0.0782 0.2442 0.2024
references:
To examine the effectiveness of the two decoupled optimization objectives independently,
we conducted experiments focusing separately on the target confidence and the non-target distributions.
As indicated in Table 4, optimizing only the target confidence outperforms Base, likely because replacing one-hot labels with a soft binomial distribution helps prevent the model from becoming over-confident. Conversely, optimization focus only on the non-target items delivers the least favorable outcomes, highlighting the critical importance of capturing user interest through positive feedback. Notably, we can observe that removing either part results in a performance decrease, emphasizing the necessity of jointly addressing both aspects and capturing user’s potential interest in items without observed feedback.
